Posts.Content: Phaedra  Or daughter of Minos (I love Greek Mythology) Congrats on getting there I think the thing to do is celebrate and fill your days once again. We said this when we were all doing the waiting game - the waiting for results like you still are. But onwards and upwards Leolady56
Posts.Title: Last Herceptin...

Posts.Content: Cannon Looks like you got a full house of 'GO'. Take care  Leolady - and please report back because we love good news and love helping (and we are all a tiny tiny bit nosey)
Posts.Title: Should i go to appointment?

Posts.Content: JessM5  Jess, no apologies needed. If you can't rant and rave on here then where can you????? GRANNY59 has said some very great things to keep in mind. And try to stick with this site as Dr Google can prove out of date and incorrect. Yes there are good articles but not enough hours in the day to find them - especially with kids around you during this school holiday We all hate the waiting game but keep posting on this thread if you need support or advice, or a good cry or a good giggle. Yup humour can be found here too. At 61 being asked to pee in a pot to see if I was pregnant!!!! I mean really I do know how babies are made. A little bit of the weird humour hope you at least grimaced for me. Another thing I thought was are you near one of the new 'One stop hospital units'.? They have begun these for people like yourself who may need further investigation regarding lumps or symptoms. Their aim is to cut the waiting time down which will mean all your worries may fade away quicker. I hope so for your sake. Until then we will be here Granny and I, plus lots of other people in your circumstances Take care and gentle hugs Leolady56
Posts.Title: Back again

Posts.Content: LiziX   Mixed blessing then. Good MOT, thorough as well for all those SE's by the medics. But a bugger you are still in there. Think positive Lizi. we could always get an escape committee together from The Awake Thread xxxx Hope there is some serious 'people watching' to pass the time.  Leolady56
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: maggiemee   Bleeping heck. This in a way will be good for others to read to know no matter what it is one heck of a SH*** indiscriminate disease and has a nasty way of hiding. Thank goodness you were a strong and determined lady. A phrase i use now is: I've been living in this body a long time and I think I know how it feels when it is well!!! As you say having some power of knowledge over it can certainly help the mindset and the 'be prepared' feeling we all need. Maggie this site will certainly give you that first hand experience, Keep posting. Keep reading and you'll certainly kick ass Leolady56
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Aliblue - gawd no wonder we need this site. Every single procedure seems to be different! My lot refuse point blank to put BP cuff over PICC. I didn't go with District lot as they will never give a time to visit and they see PICC lines low priority management (their language not mine) Still this is now all debatable as it could be bye bye PICC line and chemo I've done the same as last week and ballooned over face, neck and chest. Next week's Paclitaxol has been cancelled and I my onco on Friday. I am a little concerned as yesterday I watched the BBC Scotland prog about BC. An onco said the best medical advancement in the BC fight was Herceptin. Which I am booked to have. But I was lead to believe it is only delivered hand in hand with chemo! Struggled with sleep last night, munchies at 2am and hair falling! Joy and more joy I heard today that the formal complaint made about my last onco which has been upheld. They have noted my treatment was delayed due to his lack of knowledge. But ...... his penance is to read the NICE guidelines. That's going to hit him hard. Hope his reading skills are u to scratch. Well gentle hugs to those of living the poop Leolady56
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: LiziX   so we weren't needed to bring the escape committee. Phew. I had the Trans thingy many years ago aim is to stop the bleeding due to heavy periods- it wroked . So out of hospital and platelets up, plus no doubt lots of needed hugs and cuddles. Woooo hooo Don't go buying the papaya leaf just yet..... pharmacists are a little funny about supplements and extras as they can cause chemo and drugs to lose their efficacy. I was told no vitamins c,d and zinc whilst on chemo. Mmmmmm Oh and thanks for my new word of the week - thrombocytopenia. Every day a school day Fingers crossed you have a gentle weekend and stay put in the warmth and love of your own home. Plus that your onco comes up with a good plan. I have onco meeting on friday as my body is not keen on Paclitaxol. But at least mine was a rash ..... no posh words for me lovely and only one A&E visit. Right really ought to get out of my pit. If only to brush out the strands of hair! mmmmm Gentle hugs team chemo Leolady56

Posts.Content: Bleeping bugger and other words of dubious character  Lizi that’s the pits  But at least you went and got help. So sorry you are being admitted but all things considered it’s the best thing to do Hope they find a quiet room or ward so at least you can rest whilst the bloods drip in to mend you More hugs Leolady56 who after 2 days in bed is now wide awake!!!

Posts.Content: LiziX   I'd just popped on to see what was happening to you. Well at least a positive move to a ward appropriate for you maybe we should write a script for tv??? No one would believe it all though, after all the drama they get to see on Casualty and Holby. Plus no bleeping energy for romance or anything iffy like that  as is portrayed on those series. YUKKKKKKKK Tee hee Hugs from my bed of rest having sorted a pile of washing and washed up !!! Leolady56

Posts.Content: kathleen37 My recent discharge letter made a point of saying contact the BC TEAM if bone aches persist. If They are not controllable with the usual meds NoNo facial body shaver has had good reviews . Laser is adding more stress to your body and .... people in the beauty business are not willing to take risks. A fact not a ball of fun. Sorry Leolady56

Posts.Content: Matohu Me too. "My word you do look good and your hair is growing!!! " Yes and some days I still feel like poop. I don't sleep well and and and Life after have a read. Not too sure ...... but just maybe there is a golden nugget of support in this article and leave this lying around for others to read Leolady56 - trying to lead a new normal
